alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 14 at 4:50PM CDT until May 14 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN COFFEY AND SOUTHWESTERN OSAGE COUNTIES... At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lebo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 144 and 148. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
